comments.body: Agreed. It's not a fun balance mechanic in my opinion. Just make all leaves have the same sapling drop rate to reduce player confusion.
I agree. Impossible to reforest. Cant cut any of them down or you lose your forest.
All I would like to see is a jungle tree sapling drop rate that allows me to expand my jungle tree forest.
The jungle sapling drop rate is half of the sapling drop rates found in other trees, such as spruces which have a giant variant but still have the regular sapling drop rate
I can't use jungle wood even when living in a jungle. It's the only tree that cannot be reforested. Call it realistic all you like, using jungle wood means I have to go raze a biome

Combining yellow and blue dye in the crafting table get 2 green dyes and breeding blue and yellow sheep make green baby sheep.
If anyone read this, Try to mix 2 yellow+blue colored paint together. I wish this will be added in the next update of Minecraft so players don't need to spend their time finding desert biome for cacti to smelt it into green dye.
This would make artistic builds so much easier, since you wouldn't have to travel all the way to a desert to find cacti just for green dye. Full support, and great idea!

It would be really nice if more dyes were mixable. 
It would also teach kids(or adults) basic color theory.

Yes, please! I completely support this. I was combining dyes and found it surprising that blue and yellow don't combine to make green because that's one of the first color combinations I would check for. Finding a desert has been even harder due to the huge biomes in 1.19 so we would really benefit from a new way to obtain/make green dye. And yes, this would be beneficial to teach people color theory. I would also really appreciate a new shade of green between the dark olive green we get from cactuses and light lime green (which we get by adding white dye to olive green). It definitely would make creative builds in survival easier.
This is even more relevant with the new wool feature in Trails and Tales. It works for orange and purple, why not green? Please add this.
I'm glad it wasn't just me, if this was fixed it actually be the best thing for it. At least to add an alternative option to make green other than hunting for cacti all the time.

This is what I was going to write, not being able to mix to green is surprising, with so many dyes able to be created by mixing other color dyes. and as a new user, getting green dye from cacti is far from obvious, I had to find out by looking it up outside the game.
Abso-ABSOLUTELY!!! It takes away from the joy of the game when you can't FIND (leading to can't CRAFT) what you need. Mojang please let dyes be easier to access, please.
They gona be in caves they said that in Minecraft live

It's complete rubbish, and I'm going to abuse it until I have no accounts left if they don't get rid of it. I don't know about the rest of you but I'm getting sick of the majority of people having to suffer for the sake of a tiny minority of the weak be it online or in real life. Either they cease or everything around them metaphorically burns.

This system is fundamentally flawed in the regard that it expects us to trust a corporation to make reliable judgements of what is "right" and what is "wrong".

No corporation, ESPECIALLY MICROSOFT (or its subsidiaries), is qualified to be an arbiter of ethics or morality.

This should have been left up to a PER SERVER basis, and opt in by the people who are actually HOSTING the server. If Mojang/Microsoft wants to host their own servers and decide how THOSE servers are moderated, then fine.

But the work that I PERSONALLY PERFORM to create a space for MY FAMILY and MY FRIENDS is not a place where an arbitrary unilateral external entity (microsoft) is welcome to make managerial decisions FOR me. Stay out and step off.
I'll try to spread this post!
This is because of Microsoft, they want more sales, but probably will end up getting less using chat report.

I 100% agree that the chat reporting system should be removed. Every server is fully capable of dealing with chat reports and cheaters. Having players permanently banned for saying a swear word to a fellow player, which could also be a joke, is extremely outrageous and unfair because you're basically revoking the freedom of speech. The vast player base plays on Multiplayer servers and realms, and having them punished for something so small on one server is ridiculous to have them banned from playing Multiplayer entirely. Just let server/realm staff members deal with the chat reports. It shouldn't be something for Microsoft to interfere with.
I don't like it, it doesn't make any sense.

From someone on Reddit whom their name I have forgotten: All you have to do is have chat moderation by Mojang opt in per server, and put a prompt saying something like "I am above the age of 13 and agree to join a server without Mojang moderation". That's literally it

Me neither.

Chat Reporting sucks.

Btw it is Mojang fault, not Microsoft
It was entirely their decision
I'll share it
It is terrible, and ruins the game.

I completely agree, it's useless and pointless and majority of the player base isn't even children anyway and everyone on this game is used to toxicity and on top of that you can get banned for dumb reasons AND even if you DIDN'T get reported by anyone mojang/microsoft can still see your messages and can punish you for it.
Honestly that's just dumb because you're playing with your friends after all and they don't even take it seriously on top of that those "bad words" are censored anyways so what's the point of punishing someone that didn't even bothered by anyone?
Just get rid of the report system please.

Theres no need for it to exist, and its existence allows for harassment and abuse more than it prevents it.  Its honestly a terrible idea to allow for a system that can easily by hijacked to allow for much worse possible abuse.

All moderation they should  do should be on their own servers.
I've heard Roblox players threatening to ban through the report system. Now it's coming into Minecraft
I agree. I absolutely HATE this idea.
let servers control their own moderation
Idea: Community works together to overwhelm Microsoft with false reports.
im not surprised the autism father likes this feature
To abuse this feature is to use it.
i agree all it does is ban ON REALMS what is the point
If a player gets reported by the chat reporting, Mojang should do at most a permanent mute for a player from all servers and realms, rather than ban the player from all servers and realms.

This right here! I don't think enough players are actually living in the snow biomes for this to become relevant, sadly.

But yhea it is really annoying when am making paths and on the sides it is 1m snow

I'm pretty sure it's a bug that the snow stacks to a full block or even more. It used to melt during daytime after snowfall ended, but for quite some time now, the snow stacks so high that building and living in a snow biome in general is just tedious and annoying. Really hope this topic receives more attention.

An one year old bug? I read that the bug was first intruduced in the 1.16 update? How, WHY isn't this fixed yet?!

It is not like it's an small bug, it litterally makes the snow biomes uninhabited in my opinion

I just started a new world with my family and we're in love with the snowy mountain we started on. But the pile up of snow on the trees is really going to become a pain. It would be ideal if it functioned as it does in java and just applies a single layer where there isn't already one or make it an option to toggle.
I think solution 1 that you suggested would be perfect, maybe 1-3 layers random so it is not always flat because I like the varied levels in the snow biomes a lot, but it does get too much.

On the bright side of things, the bug report reporting the excessive snow stacking is finally labeled as confirmed. It will still takes years before it gets fixed I reckon. The devs are giving it their best but bedrock edition is in a rather rough state at the moment.

Yeah as a map creator, I hate snow stacking. I want weather to show and effect the visuals without actually effecting the overall landscape. 

I have mountainous areas that I want snow to be visible in. They already have extremely realistic snow caps that flow down the mountains into rivers. These are the only places snow layers exist. And they shouldn't be changed at all. I want to disable the snow stacking feature just so it doesn't effect anything too much.
Java now has an option to control snow stacking, all they have to do now is add it to Bedrock.
Please add this. The more I look at snow piling in bedrock the more I hate it, I wanna see pretty flat snowy landscapes
I want sweeping edge for bedrock because it seems really cool.

Still aint fixed. I hate this game man, just spent a few day building a castle on a mountain and the snow just keeps on stacking up. They wont fix it tho, as long as they get money from their marketplace, they dont give a fu

Your first solution seems to be the most logical. It makes perfect sense for snow to melt when it's sunny! 

Infinite snow stacking is really annoying and turns building in snowy biomes into a painful experience... I hope it'll get fixed!!

As somebody who always tries to settle in snowy biomes, It gets really annoying in long term worlds when my house or door way becomes entirely useless without a constant supply of shovels. Not only can it get in the way, but it also tends to make a former flat looking snowscape become extremely bumpy.
Yeah this is really annoying I hope they fix this

It‚Äôs extremely frustrating. It‚Äôs ridiculous how Mojang can‚Äôt transfer the game rule which works perfectly well in Java to Bedrock. I really wish they‚Äôd do something about this, as it‚Äôs just impossible to spend any amount of time in the snow. Anything, and I mean anything you build will be completely coated in snow. It‚Äôs sad to me that I can‚Äôt build in the snow without constant upkeep.

This is not really an overhaul, you've proposed exactly one change :P

I'm pretty sure you can adjust cloud height in the options menu, have you tried doing that?
I thought overhaul meant to change drastically not to make lots of changes, also if there is an option to change cloud height I think I would have came across it by now.

Hmm. Well, a gamerule or an option would be fine, I suppose, but the way it currently is needs to be the default. If you go high enough in the air irl you do fly through clouds, so it makes sense that it would work that way in Minecraft, too.
In real life clouds go around not through.
I agree. I've always been disappointed that they didn't double the height and size of clouds when they doubled the world height limit back in 1.2.
Adjusted subject to best reflect contents.

It would be awesome if they could add the cloud height as a configuration value when creating a map, along with the ability to disable it completely.  Ground level clouds for maps that are meant to seem foggy... high clouds for sky island maps that you don't want clouds clipping through buildings...
If the value was stored in the map data rather than controlled by the client, map creators would have more control over the "atmosphere" of their map (pardon the pun).
This is a terrible idea

yea man we need that feature so bad :(
It's back! No UI for customizing the worlds this time, but you can do a whole lot more with it now.

Customized is "back", but make the quotation marks on that word huge because even if it did have an interface, this new copy is a hollow imitation of the original. Sure, the new features the 1.16 one has are nice, but we need the features we already had much more. We still haven't had a return on ore settings and independent X/Z noise stretching, and some other things which I don't explicitly know about - because the new feature is really hard to research and compare with the old one - and this makes for an untold thousands of good Customized things that we still can't do in the most recent version of Minecraft. We can't be complacent, Custom 1.16 does not have everything it needs. It doesn't matter if a feature of 1.12 that hasn't come back looks small and unimportant, because for hundreds of people the chances are very high that the feature is an important one and had some really enthused plans riding on it. Saying it doesn't need to come back on the grounds that "I don't care, I have no idea what I'd use it for" would be a selfish reason to deprive somebody of it who has a good idea for what they want to use it for.
it's "back" but without  UI and preloaded maps :(

This is really silly in my opinion.  I have a few decorative areas and secret tunnels in the Java Edition that I use by trap door crawling.  I think it's a fun way to connect two places that don't need walkways but occasionally you'd want to travel down.  Also cool for hidden stashes or crafting areas, hidden beds.. etc.  Possibilities are endless here.  The funny thing about this is that you CAN SWINM WHICH IS THE SAME ANIMATION AND BLOCK SIZE.  I have an "underwater entrance" into my enchanting area and it's basically two rows of slabs that let you swim through but water doesn't leak in.  Fun way to get into the base quick.

It would also bring some more parity between the different editions of the game.
